affiliation.ce:source-text: Department of Pure Mathematics, Ferdowsi University of Mashhad, Mashhad, Iran

head.citation-title: Quaternionic inverse Fourier transforms on locally compact abelian groups
head.abstracts: © 2020 Informa UK Limited, trading as Taylor & Francis Group.In this paper, after introducing the concepts of quaternionic dual group and the quaternionic valued character on locally compact abelian group (Formula presented.), the inverse of the quaternionic Fourier transform (QFT) on locally compact abelian groups is investigated. Due to the non-commutativity of multiplication of quaternions, there are different types of QFTs right, left and two-sided quaternionic Fourier transform. We focus on the right-sided quaternionic Fourier transform (RQFT) and two-sided quaternionic Fourier transform (SQFT). We establish the quaternionic Plancherel and inversion theorems for the square integrable quaternionic-valued signals on (Formula presented.), the space (Formula presented.), where G is a locally compact abelian group. Also RQFT on the space (Formula presented.) is studied. Furthermore relations between RQFT and SQFT are discussed. These results provide new proofs for the classical inverse Fourier transform, Plancherel theorem, etc. in (Formula presented.).

coredata.dc:description: In this paper, after introducing the concepts of quaternionic dual group and the quaternionic valued character on locally compact abelian group (Formula presented.), the inverse of the quaternionic Fourier transform (QFT) on locally compact abelian groups is investigated. Due to the non-commutativity of multiplication of quaternions, there are different types of QFTs right, left and two-sided quaternionic Fourier transform. We focus on the right-sided quaternionic Fourier transform (RQFT) and two-sided quaternionic Fourier transform (SQFT). We establish the quaternionic Plancherel and inversion theorems for the square integrable quaternionic-valued signals on (Formula presented.), the space (Formula presented.), where G is a locally compact abelian group. Also RQFT on the space (Formula presented.) is studied. Furthermore relations between RQFT and SQFT are discussed. These results provide new proofs for the classical inverse Fourier transform, Plancherel theorem, etc. in (Formula presented.).
